src:
Nizke temperature ne smejo biti izgovor
Tudi v mrzlih mesecih mora imeti vadba pomembno vlogo v našem življenju, marsikomu pa nižje temperature celo olajšajo rekreacijo, sploh če se gibamo na prostem.
03 Nov 2019, 11:52 by Ema Bubanj



Če gremo v hribe, ne pozabimo na palice! FOTO: Guliver/Getty Images



Najmlajši ne potrebujejo organizirane vadbe in treningov. FOTO: Guliver/Getty Images



Največ pozornosti namenimo izbiri ustrezne obutve. FOTO: Guliver/Getty Images



K redni vadbi obvezno dodamo krepilne vaje za mišice. FOTO: Guliver/Getty Images


Jesen nas je dolgo razvajala z visokimi temperaturami, zdaj pa je vreme le pokazalo zobe in spet resno naznanilo zimo. A hladnejši letni čas še zdaleč ni izgovor, da bi vse dni poležavali v dnevni sobi; razvajanje in sproščanje, sploh v večernih urah in še posebno v dobri družbi, sicer ne smeta izostati, a prav tako moramo kljub kratkemu dnevu vsak dan nekaj časa nameniti vadbi. Tudi po mrzlem in mokrem.
Za dobro počutje, trden značaj in zdravje


Najmlajši ne potrebujejo organizirane vadbe in treningov. FOTO: Guliver/Getty Images

»Gibanje nas krepi ter pomaga preprečevati ali zmanjševati dejavnike tveganja, ki so vzrok za številne bolezni srca in ožilja. Te vključujejo debelost, visok krvni tlak, povišane vrednosti sladkorja, holesterola in maščob v krvi. Obenem pa gibanje pomaga tudi pri premagovanju stresa in izboljšanju razpoloženja,« poudarja izr. prof. dr. Blaž Mavčič, dr. med., specialist ortopedije iz Medicinskega centra Barsos. Gibanje prinaša vrsto ugodnih terapevtskih učinkov, s katerimi ublažimo bolečine ter druge vsakodnevne tegobe, ki jih povzročajo kronične bolezni, in ima nenadomestljivo vlogo v vseh življenjskih obdobjih človeka.Ključno je za otrokov razvoj, telesni, duševni in socialni, in za ohranjanje vitalnosti ter izboljšanje kakovosti življenja v starejših obdobjih.»Najmlajši otroci se radi veliko gibajo, zato ne potrebujejo organizirane vadbe in treningov. Dovolj je, če so na igrišču, v parku ali gozdu, kjer lahko tečejo, plezajo, se lovijo, telovadijo, skratka, uživajo v gibanju in svobodi. Pozneje je telesna aktivnost dobra podlaga za razvoj pozitivnih strani osebnosti in oblikovanja značaja z močno voljo,« nadaljuje sogovornik.Največkrat so krivi zdrsiMed najpogostejše poškodbe pozimi spadajo poškodbe kolena, zapestja, kolka in glave, največkrat zaradi zdrsov na drsečih površinah. Veliko poškodb je povezanih z neustrezno opremo in nezadostno pripravo na rekreacijo. Pri lažjih aktivnostih pogosto niti ne razmišljamo o morebitnih nevarnostih, a ravno takrat lahko nastane poškodba. Previdni morajo biti predvsem občasni rekreativci oziroma tisti, ki se s športom dlje niso ukvarjali.Športni trening razvija iniciativnost, samostojnost, zaupanje, vztrajnost in odločnost. Otrok se nauči preživeti poraze in se ponovno pobrati. Velika večina otrok se do 15. leta preneha aktivno in resneje ukvarjati s športom, ostanejo le še tisti, ki dosegajo relativno dobre rezultate. A šport je za najstnike zelo pomemben, saj jim pomaga ohranjati normalno telesno težo, manj možnosti imajo za kasnejši pojav sladkorne bolezni v zrelih letih, na splošno imajo manj težav z zdravjem, predvsem pa jim šport pomaga ohraniti dobro samopodobo.« Priporočljivo je, da se otroci gibljejo vsaj 60 minut na dan, odrasli najmanj 30, starejši pa naj se vsak dan odpravijo na sprehod in svež zrak. Nikoli pa ne škoduje, če naredimo kakšno vajo več. Kot smo že pisali, vsakodnevna telesna dejavnost pomaga tudi srcu, ožilju in sploh skrbi za dobro počutje in presnovo ter pomaga preprečevati številna obolenja, nadvse pa nam bodo koristile krepilne vaje za velike mišične skupine ter ravnotežje in vsekakor raztezanje, priporočajo strokovnjaki.Ogrevanje je nujnoPreden se lotite dvigovanja uteži, počepov ali trebušnjakov, moramo mišice telesa skrbno ogreti na delovno temperaturo in jih iz stanja mirovanja spraviti v pripravljenost na večje obremenitve, sicer se lahko preobremenjena mišica hitro poškoduje. Zato pred vadbo vsaj deset ali petnajst minut kolesarimo, tečemo, hitro hodimo in opravimo nekaj ogrevalnih in razteznih vaj. Tudi če se pred treningom dovolj ogrejemo, moramo paziti, da mišic ne obremenimo prehitro in preveč. Intenziteto in težavnost treninga stopnjujemo postopoma: najprej uporabimo nekoliko manjšo težo, potem pa lahko pri naslednji seriji iste vaje izberemo že nekoliko težje uteži, seveda brez pretiravanja.
Pomembna je ustrezna oprema
Tudi v hladnih mesecih mora imeti vadba pomembno vlogo v našem življenju, marsikomu pa nižje temperature celo olajšajo rekreacijo, sploh če se gibamo na prostem. »Priporočamo, da jeseni nadaljujete enako vadbo kot poleti, le da ne pozabite na dodatno opremo, ki je nujna v hladnejšem letnem času. Vsekakor poskrbite za toplejša športna oblačila v obliki športnih nogavic, dolgih športnih hlač in majic z dolgimi rokavi. Tudi vetrovka s kapuco ali športni jopič vam bosta prišla zelo prav,« svetuje izr. prof. dr. Mavčič. »Ko je ozračje ohlajeno, odpade uporaba poletnih superg in tankih nogavic. Jeseni postanejo poti, ki smo jih navajeni, bolj vlažne, blatne in spolzke. Odpadlo listje, deževno vreme in poledica so pasti, na katere moramo biti pripravljeni. Pri športni aktivnosti na nižjih temperaturah moramo vzdrževati konstantno intenzivnost aktivnosti, da se ne ohlajamo.«
Priporočljivo je, da se otroci gibljejo vsaj 60 minut na dan, odrasli najmanj 30 minut.
Veliko pozornosti namenimo obutvi, ki nam mora zagotavljati stabilnost in ne sme premočiti: »Čevlji z boljšim oprijemom in palice so obvezna oprema pri hoji v hribe in vzponih, saj je pri razmočenem terenu in odpadlem listju velika možnost zdrsov.« Topla oblačila, ki ne zadržujejo vlage, bodo prav tako odlična izbira, sicer pa je na tržišču veliko športnih oblačil, ki so prilagojena treningu pri nižjih temperaturah. »Prav tako je pomembno, da pred mrazom in vetrom zaščitite vrat in ledveni predel trupa. Rokavice so zaradi mraza in boljšega oprijema nepogrešljiv pripomoček pri vadbi na fitnesu na prostem, plezanju ali drugih športih, pri katerih potrebujemo roke. Aktivnosti na prostem se moramo vsekakor lotiti premišljeno in se zavedati, da spremembe v letnem času niso zanemarljive. Niti pri rekreativnem športu ne,« še priporoča zdravnik.
text:
Low temperatures should not be an excuse
Even in the cold months, exercise has an important role to play in our lives, and in many cases lower temperatures even make it easier to recreate, even if we move outdoors.
03 Nov 2019, 11:52 by Ema Bubanj



Going into the hills, let's not forget the bars! PHOTO: Gulliver / Getty Images



The youngest do not need organized exercise and training. PHOTO: Gulliver / Getty Images



Most attention is paid to choosing the right footwear. PHOTO: Gulliver / Getty Images



Muscle strengthening exercises must be added to regular exercise. PHOTO: Gulliver / Getty Images


Autumn used to spoil us with high temperatures for a long time, but now the weather has just shown teeth and again a serious winter. But the colder season is far from being an excuse to lie in the living room all day; pampering and relaxing, especially in the evenings and especially in good company, may not be out of the question, but we also need to devote some time to exercise despite the short day. Even after cold and wet.
For well-being, solid character and health


The youngest do not need organized exercise and training. PHOTO: Gulliver / Getty Images

“Movement strengthens us and helps prevent or reduce the risk factors that cause many cardiovascular diseases. These include obesity, high blood pressure, elevated blood sugar, cholesterol and fat levels. At the same time, movement also helps to overcome stress and improve mood, "emphasizes Assoc. prof. dr. Blaž Mavčič, Ph.D. med., orthopedic specialist from Barsos Medical Center. The movement has a number of beneficial therapeutic effects to alleviate the pain and other everyday ailments caused by chronic diseases, and it has an irreplaceable role in all stages of human life. It is crucial for the child's development, physical, mental and social, and for maintaining vitality and improvement quality of life in older times. "Youngest children like to move a lot, so they do not need organized exercise and training. It is enough if they are on the playground, in the park or in the forest where they can run, climb, hunt, exercise, in short, enjoy movement and freedom. Later, physical activity is a good basis for developing positive personality and strong-willed character formation, "the interviewee continues. The most common injuries in winter are injuries to the knee, wrist, hip and head, most often because of slippage on slippery surfaces. Many injuries are associated with inadequate equipment and inadequate preparation for recreation. In light activities, we often don't even think about the potential dangers, but that's when an injury can occur. Particular attention should be paid to casual recreational athletes or those who have not practiced sports for a long time. Sports training develops initiative, independence, confidence, perseverance and determination. The child learns to survive defeat and regain his composure. The vast majority of children by the age of 15 cease to be active and more serious in sports, and only those who achieve relatively good results remain. But sports are very important for teenagers as they help them maintain their normal body weight, are less likely to have diabetes later on in adulthood, generally have less health problems, and above all, sports help them maintain good self-esteem. ”It is recommended that children move for at least 60 minutes a day, adults at least 30, and seniors should go for a walk and fresh air every day. It never hurts to do any more exercise. As mentioned earlier, daily physical activity also helps the heart, blood vessels and overall well-being and metabolism, and helps prevent many ailments, and will greatly benefit us from strengthening exercises for large muscle groups as well as balance and stretching, experts recommend. start lifting weights, pins, or tummy tucks, the muscles of the body must be carefully warmed to working temperature and brought to standby for heavy loads from rest, otherwise the overloaded muscle can be damaged quickly. Therefore, before exercising for at least ten or fifteen minutes, we cycle, run, walk fast and do some warm-up and stretching exercises. Even if you warm up well enough before your workout, you need to be careful not to strain your muscles too quickly and excessively. We intensify the intensity and difficulty of the training gradually: first, we use a slightly lower weight, then we can choose slightly heavier weights in the next series of the same exercise, without exaggeration, of course.
Proper equipment is important
Even during the cold months, exercise has an important role to play in our lives, and in many cases, lower temperatures even make it easier to recreate, even if we move outdoors. “We recommend that you continue the same exercise in the fall as in the summer, but do not forget about the accessories that are necessary in the colder season. Make sure to wear warmer sportswear in the form of socks, long pants, and long-sleeved shirts. Even a hooded sweatshirt or sports jacket will come in handy, ”advises Assoc. prof. dr. Mavčič. »When the atmosphere is cool, summer sneakers and socks will disappear. In the fall, the paths we are used to become more humid, muddy and slippery. Waste foliage, rainy weather and icing are traps that we must be prepared for. In sports activities at lower temperatures, we need to maintain a constant intensity of activity so that we do not cool down. "
It is recommended that children move for at least 60 minutes a day, adults at least 30 minutes.
Much attention is paid to footwear, which must give us stability and must not overpower: "Shoes with better grip and sticks are a must when walking in hills and climbs, as there is a high chance of slipping in damp terrain and fallen leaves." moisture retention will also be a great choice, but there are plenty of sportswear on the market that is tailored to training at lower temperatures. “It is also important to protect the neck and lumbar region of the torso from cold and wind. Gloves are an indispensable accessory for outdoor fitness, rock climbing or other sports where we need our hands because of the cold and better grip. Certainly outdoor activities must be considered carefully, and the changes in the season are not negligible. Not even in recreational sports, ”the doctor recommends.
